sections.text: Cancellation of judicial mortgage arising from judgment that has prescribedNotwithstanding the reinscription of a judicial mortgage created by the filing of a judgment of a court of this state, the recorder shall cancel the judicial mortgage from his records upon any person's written request to which is attached a certificate from the clerk of the court rendering the judgment that no suit or motion was filed for its revival within the time required by Article 3501 or of a certified copy of a final and definitive judgment of the court rejecting the demands of the plaintiff in a suit or motion to revive the judgment.Acts 2005, No. 169, ยง1, eff. Jan. 1, 2006; Acts 2005, 1st Ex. Sess., No. 13, ยง1, eff. Nov. 29, 2005; Acts 2014, No. 281, ยง1, eff. Jan. 1, 2015.NOTE: Acts 2005, 1st Ex. Sess., No. 13, ยง1, changed the effective date of Acts 2005, No. 169, to July 1, 2006.
